name: Chinese Music
description: Music of the Chinese people, which is primarily derived from the culture of the Han Chinese.

children.name: Ancient Chinese Music
children.description: Covers a very large era of creation from approximately 2100 BCE to 200 CE.

children.name: Campus Folk
children.description: Born in Taiwan in the mid-1970s, this movement originated with university students creating their own modern-style songs in the wake of international tensions like Taiwan's isolation from the United Nations and the United States' embrace of the PRC as a diplomatic partner.

children.name: Chinese Classical Music
children.description: Classical Music of China, encompassing royal court music.

children.name: Chinese Folk Music
children.description: Traditional folk of the Chinese people.

children.name: Chinese Opera
children.description: Traditional Chinese theatre, existing in several regional variations, combining traditional instruments and vocals along with other art forms like Poetry, dance, acrobatics, and martial arts.

children.name: Minyue
children.description: Modernized composition for Chinese instruments on the basis of Chinese Folk Music, incorporating aspects of Western Classical Music.

children.name: Naxi Music
children.description: Musical traditions of the Naxi peoples, fusing Chinese Music with local Naxi influences.

children.name: Quyi
children.description: Category of traditional Chinese storytelling, featuring a narrative structure and a combination of speaking and singing.

children.name: Shidaiqu
children.description: Fusion of Chinese popular music and Jazz that began in the 1920s in Shanghai.

children.name: Sizhu Music
children.description: Traditional string and wind instrument based chamber music ensembles, prevalent in Southern China.

children.name: Taoist Ritual Music
children.description: Originating in chants and instrumental accompaniment for Taoist ritual practice.

children.name: Xibei feng
children.description: Blends Traditional Folk Music elements from northwestern China with Western Rock, Pop, Contemporary Folk, and other styles, characterized by its rugged and bold style.

children.name: Xinyao
children.description: Singaporean Mandarin-language style, generally featuring harmonised group vocals and backed mainly by acoustic guitar.

children.name: Zhongguo feng
children.description: Inspired by traditional elements of Chinese Music with lyrical themes constantly revolving around Chinese culture and tales.
